chapter.keywords: online king james holy bible, king james bible, bible todo list, words of Jesus, bible index, the authorised version, KJV, KJB, KJAV, AV

items.text: The preparations of the heart in man, and the answer of the tongue, is from the LORD.
items.plainText: The preparations of the heart in man, and the answer of the tongue, is from the LORD.

items.text: All the ways of a man are clean in his own eyes; but the LORD weigheth the spirits.
items.plainText: All the ways of a man are clean in his own eyes; but the LORD weigheth the spirits.

items.text: Commit thy works unto the LORD, and thy thoughts shall be established.
items.plainText: Commit thy works unto the LORD, and thy thoughts shall be established.

items.text: The LORD hath made all things for himself: yea, even the wicked for the day of evil.
items.plainText: The LORD hath made all things for himself: yea, even the wicked for the day of evil.

items.text: Every one that is proud in heart is an abomination to the LORD: though hand join in hand, he shall not be unpunished.
items.plainText: Every one that is proud in heart is an abomination to the LORD: though hand join in hand, he shall not be unpunished.

items.text: By mercy and truth iniquity is purged: and by the fear of the LORD men depart from evil.
items.plainText: By mercy and truth iniquity is purged: and by the fear of the LORD men depart from evil.

items.text: When a man's ways please the LORD, he maketh even his enemies to be at peace with him.
items.plainText: When a man's ways please the LORD, he maketh even his enemies to be at peace with him.

items.text: Better is a little with righteousness than great revenues without right.
items.plainText: Better is a little with righteousness than great revenues without right.

items.text: A man's heart deviseth his way: but the LORD directeth his steps.
items.plainText: A man's heart deviseth his way: but the LORD directeth his steps.

items.text: A divine sentence is in the lips of the king: his mouth transgresseth not in judgment.
items.plainText: A divine sentence is in the lips of the king: his mouth transgresseth not in judgment.

items.text: A just weight and balance are the LORD's: all the weights of the bag are his work.
items.plainText: A just weight and balance are the LORD's: all the weights of the bag are his work.

items.text: It is an abomination to kings to commit wickedness: for the throne is established by righteousness.
items.plainText: It is an abomination to kings to commit wickedness: for the throne is established by righteousness.

items.text: Righteous lips are the delight of kings; and they love him that speaketh right.
items.plainText: Righteous lips are the delight of kings; and they love him that speaketh right.

items.text: The wrath of a king is as messengers of death: but a wise man will pacify it.
items.plainText: The wrath of a king is as messengers of death: but a wise man will pacify it.

items.text: In the light of the king's countenance is life; and his favour is as a cloud of the latter rain.
items.plainText: In the light of the king's countenance is life; and his favour is as a cloud of the latter rain.

items.text: How much better is it to get wisdom than gold! and to get understanding rather to be chosen than silver!
items.plainText: How much better is it to get wisdom than gold! and to get understanding rather to be chosen than silver!

items.text: The highway of the upright is to depart from evil: he that keepeth his way preserveth his soul.
items.plainText: The highway of the upright is to depart from evil: he that keepeth his way preserveth his soul.

items.text: Pride goeth before destruction, and an haughty spirit before a fall.
items.plainText: Pride goeth before destruction, and an haughty spirit before a fall.

items.text: Better it is to be of an humble spirit with the lowly, than to divide the spoil with the proud.
items.plainText: Better it is to be of an humble spirit with the lowly, than to divide the spoil with the proud.

items.text: He that handleth a matter wisely shall find good: and whoso trusteth in the LORD, happy is he.
items.plainText: He that handleth a matter wisely shall find good: and whoso trusteth in the LORD, happy is he.

items.text: The wise in heart shall be called prudent: and the sweetness of the lips increaseth learning.
items.plainText: The wise in heart shall be called prudent: and the sweetness of the lips increaseth learning.

items.text: Understanding is a wellspring of life unto him that hath it: but the instruction of fools is folly.
items.plainText: Understanding is a wellspring of life unto him that hath it: but the instruction of fools is folly.

items.text: The heart of the wise teacheth his mouth, and addeth learning to his lips.
items.plainText: The heart of the wise teacheth his mouth, and addeth learning to his lips.

items.text: Pleasant words are as an honeycomb, sweet to the soul, and health to the bones.
items.plainText: Pleasant words are as an honeycomb, sweet to the soul, and health to the bones.

items.text: There is a way that seemeth right unto a man, but the end thereof are the ways of death.
items.plainText: There is a way that seemeth right unto a man, but the end thereof are the ways of death.

items.text: He that laboureth laboureth for himself; for his mouth craveth it of him.
items.plainText: He that laboureth laboureth for himself; for his mouth craveth it of him.

items.text: An ungodly man diggeth up evil: and in his lips there is as a burning fire.
items.plainText: An ungodly man diggeth up evil: and in his lips there is as a burning fire.

items.text: A froward man soweth strife: and a whisperer separateth chief friends.
items.plainText: A froward man soweth strife: and a whisperer separateth chief friends.

items.text: A violent man enticeth his neighbour, and leadeth him into the way that is not good.
items.plainText: A violent man enticeth his neighbour, and leadeth him into the way that is not good.

items.text: He shutteth his eyes to devise froward things: moving his lips he bringeth evil to pass.
items.plainText: He shutteth his eyes to devise froward things: moving his lips he bringeth evil to pass.

items.text: The hoary head is a crown of glory, if it be found in the way of righteousness.
items.plainText: The hoary head is a crown of glory, if it be found in the way of righteousness.

items.text: He that is slow to anger is better than the mighty; and he that ruleth his spirit than he that taketh a city.
items.plainText: He that is slow to anger is better than the mighty; and he that ruleth his spirit than he that taketh a city.

items.text: The lot is cast into the lap; but the whole disposing thereof is of the LORD.
items.plainText: The lot is cast into the lap; but the whole disposing thereof is of the LORD.
